channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping at the bin area in Merlin gardens, 1st August
item.description:
There is a constant issue with fly tipping in this close. I have reported to Lewisham and phoenix repeatedly. There is rubbish over spilling from the bins and lots of fly tipping which is causing vermin to run wild in this close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Gardens, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping at Aden Lodge, 1st August
item.description:
Fly-tipping at the front and back of Aden Lodge. There's household waste, food waste and construction waste which has been there for some time. Please clear this

item.title: There is a pot hole on the pavement near door number 7, 1st August
item.description:
It has been there for the longest time, over a year. When it is dark, it is hard to see it and coming home from work one day I slipped into it and lightly sprained my ankle. All of Barforth road pavement (on the side where there are all house, 1-25 I think) there is no one meter stretch the is not a patchwork of different surfaces that are not smooth to walk on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barforth Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement and kerb litter not picked up., 1st August
item.description:
The rubbish is often from the cars who park on the road when they attend the church on the next road. They often sit in their cars before, during and after the services casually dropping their litter from the cars. I have seen them do. I have even seen a nappy dropped out of the window. I have left polite notes at the church…. Plus the usual dog poop on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barforth Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blandford Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch needs pruning, 1st August
item.description:
A branch of this tree has been growing steadily towards my window and it has now hit my window. In addition, this tree has been dropping lots and lots of ripe fruits causing slippery hazards, attracting lots of flies and swaps let alone creating lots of messes and stains on cars park underneath and the ground that are very hard to clean. Please could you assess and have it pruned. Thank you very much.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
